intro: Stauracanthus genistoides subsp. vicentinus, commonly known as the Vicentine broom, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
